website_summaries.verdict: This versatile, strong, and comfortable pad is made for most boards and surfers.
pros: One of the more affordable options from a reputable company, this three-piece pad fits most riders and boards
Steep tail kick appeals to advanced surfers
enhanced gripping pattern is ideal for all riders
Minimal center arch accommodates most feet
cons: Primarily black design features only a modest color accent with a limited number of options

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but a little thin
customer_reviews.text: I get new surfboards fairly often (about 3-4 a year) and traction pads at the store can be quite expensive. This is my first time trying a cheaper no-name brand from Amazon and I must admit, I am quite surprised. The quality of the pad is pretty good. Just the right amount of grip without being too rough but not slippery either. The only downside to this pad is that it's a little thinner than I would like. Some people might like that but I prefer having a little more cushion for the pushin'. Other than that, I would likely buy another one again. I want to see how it holds up for a whole season and then reevaluate.
customer_reviews.author: Devan

customer_reviews.title: Superb traction and adhesive  non-traditional application
customer_reviews.text: These pads are a great combination of traction, firmness, and grip. Having said that, I'm using them in an unusual way, probably not as they were designed. I use them as pads for the sides my electric unicycle, to provide grip and also a wedge that I can lean into to accelerate. Thanks for the great product!
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Garnier

customer_reviews.title: spend the extra 4 bucks and get a better one
customer_reviews.text: returning this unused. 1) Foam is SUPER SUPER RIGID, unlike better surf pads. 2) surprisingly small 3) packed poorly, 3 sections stacked up and smashed into an ill fitting box. Arrived beat up. M
customer_reviews.author: Boris and Natasha

customer_reviews.title: Generic traction pad.  That's a good thing!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly the same as pads that cost two or three times as much. And the packaging it's shipped in fits in a mailbox. I have been a surfer for almost twenty years.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Crimmins

customer_reviews.title: Peelerz
customer_reviews.text: Not a good pad, started peeling off during first use...installed exactly how i do on all my boards with quality pads. Thought i'd try a cheaper one thinking it would be okay and proved myself wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Inthacut

customer_reviews.title: Durable, works and a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Works great especially for the price. I’ve used it multiple times and the adhesive has held up. The foam isn’t thin and cheap so it’s a pretty good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Puruggs

customer_reviews.title: Good pad, does the job
customer_reviews.text: It’s good, nothing fantastic but does that job so what else can you ask for. The pad needs an extra day to adhere but besides that it be good
customer_reviews.author: James Vigeant

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as top brands
customer_reviews.text: Pads look and feel great. Just bought a Channel Islands one for another board, double the price and exact same quality. Havent tester the stickiness yet since it’s only a month old but same 3M stick as the top brands. Def worth it and the price is 🔥
customer_reviews.author: KB73

customer_reviews.title: Rear pad
customer_reviews.text: Worth the money, works fine on my hydrofoil board. Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Thom

customer_reviews.title: Amazing grip!
customer_reviews.text: Looks great on my Exile skimboard! The grip is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Perfect design and quality. It works the same as a brand track pad but for half of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Gaston

customer_reviews.title: I would probably buy again
customer_reviews.text: It’s decent for the price, it’s a bit smaller than I thought but it has held up for the many times I’ve used it so I’m not mad! Looks cool too.
customer_reviews.author: BeauMiller

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: Decent traction pad, but not that big. Works well enough, and easy
customer_reviews.author: Pay it forward Review a Product

customer_reviews.title: Great adhesive
customer_reviews.text: Placed this on our son’s surf board this summer. Easy to apply and strong adhesive has made it the perfect grip.
customer_reviews.author: Hokiefan

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.  Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive and does the same job as traction pads costing more than twice as much. Only difference may be that arch support is smaller than other pads.
customer_reviews.author: E. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Quality glue and grip.
customer_reviews.text: Could be a bit larger, but overall a great product at the right price.
customer_reviews.author: A. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Great 5 piece traction at an excellent price! Buy it!!
customer_reviews.text: Great traction pad! Hard to find 5 piece pads these days, glad I found this one. Excellent quality. Stinks it started at $15.99 and kept going up in price. Still a great deal at $20+! Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Long Beach Guy

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, Good Price!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this traction pad on for a few weeks now and so far it has been great. It is significantly cheaper than the brand names and so far it has held up great. I was worried it would become unstuck easily but so far that has not been the case. Worth it if you want a traction pad for less!
customer_reviews.author: ArthurGPlatel

customer_reviews.title: Easy to apply and serves the purpose for exactly it was purchased for.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for both my boys skimboards. They were super easy to put on and fit their feet perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative
customer_reviews.text: Cheaper alternative to $35 pads. Quality seems average so we'll see.
customer_reviews.author: MattSz

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Attach
customer_reviews.text: Great pad, great price, why pay 50 at the surf shop. Thanks!!
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: 🤙
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping. Got it a week ago, seems to adhere to the board pretty well. It breaks up in 3 pieces so you can play to ensure you get your tail completely covered. Tried it today feels great, lightweight as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Started peeling after first session with it
customer_reviews.text: Looks good and all but the first time I used it, it started peeling. I cleaned my board thoroughly and stuck it on a week before I actually used it. Disappointed that I now have to get a new pad after a day of use
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than Punt brand
customer_reviews.text: Good quality for the price. Better than punt Brand. I wouldn’t really buy this for a new board because the grip is a little slippery compared to high end traction pads. Great for an old board or just a cheap backup.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: worked perfect
customer_reviews.text: Comes in 3 separate pieces so you can have extra space between the pads. Very sticky
customer_reviews.author: edie smith

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: This product was just as expected. For the price point it wasn’t going to be the highest quality but for someone who only boards a few times a year it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Good pad for the price
customer_reviews.text: The pad is the bare bones basic pad. It’s too narrow for my short boards, but using the extra pads, I was able to widen the pad to cover the tail. No complaints, decent pad for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Harrington

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great trac-pad for the price! Just as good and the same construction as a $40 one.
customer_reviews.author: Shiloh

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This traction pad works and is great deal for price
customer_reviews.author: New York River

customer_reviews.title: Good price and good product
customer_reviews.text: have had it on my board for a couple sessions now. Grippy, my foot doesn’t slide around and the price is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Received the product and was pleasantly surprised at how well it is made. Exceeded my expectation. Will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Divenut

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Stomp pad was great but the two tiny pad that it comes with are almost useless
customer_reviews.author: Erin  Stark

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! Glue it really hard and I used for my electric unicycle.
customer_reviews.author: Ismahan Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: Nice feel and fit my board! I haven’t been in the water yet.
customer_reviews.author: Sewell

customer_reviews.title: Good quality traction
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and amazing price. Does what it needs to, provide traction for the back foot when surfing.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Lacson

customer_reviews.title: Needs better adhesive
customer_reviews.text: After 2 days of use one of the back pads no longer sticks to the board.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Ross

customer_reviews.title: Solid pad for a good price
customer_reviews.text: Exact same pad as ones selling for 4x the price. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Larson

product_meta.title: OCEANBROAD Surfboard EVA Traction Pad with 3M Adhesive Professional Tail Pad with Arch and Kicker for Short Board Long Board
product_meta.description: OCEANBROAD surfboard traction pads are made of A-grade UV resistant EVA and marine grade 3M Green adhesive. It’s a professional surf tail pad designed for high performance and better comfort. This surfing deck pad weighs only 3 oz, and comes in 3 pieces with general size of 11.75’’x11.75’’ (30cm x 30cm). It's a traction grip pad fits almost all kinds of surfboards.
feature_bullets: SUPER GRIP with COMFORT: A-grade EVA traction deck pad cut with small diamond grooves; hard brushed all over the surface provides ultimate grip and soft comfort to the feet.

MARINE GRADE 3M ADHESIVE + DUST FREE TREATMENT: This surfboard traction pad is special treated to minimize dust on them before putting up the 3M adhesive, so the super bonding ability won’t be compromised.
PERFORMANCE DESIGN: The surf tail pad is with 25mm beveled tail kicker, and fading center arch (max. height at 10mm) with holes.
FIT ALL BOARDS: 3-piece template with general size of 11.75’’x11.75’’ (30cm x 30cm), it's a traction grip pad fits almost all kinds of surfboards.
WORRY FREE PURCHASE: OCEANBROAD offers complete customer satisfaction of replacement or refund for any quality issues.
